title: ['West and East Border Roads closed for public safety', 'Gachado Line Camp open. Southeast border road and access roads closed', 'Pozo Nuevo Road to Bates Well Ranch High Clearance, 4-Wheel Drive Only']
description: ['The border roads remain closed (the dirt roads directly along the border and all crossover roads leading from South Puerto Blanco Drive to the border) to all public vehicle and pedestrian traffic for public safety. South Puerto Blanco Drive remains open.', 'El Camino De Dos Republicas remains open from SR85 to Gachado Line Camp. Dos Lomitas is not accessible. The southeast border road from Lukeville Port of Entry eastward to the Santa Rosa Mountains is closed to public vehicle and pedestrian traffic.', 'High Clearance, 4-wheel drive is required from where Pozo Nuevo Road begins along South Puerto Blanch Drive to Bates Well Ranch area. The road is washed out in areas. Bates Well Ranch is still accessible from the north on Darby Well Road.']

title: ['Road Updates Due to Heavy Rains and Flooding', 'South Woolum Road Closed, Alternate Route Available', 'Parking is not permitted on the Kyles Landing Road (County Road 56)', 'Spring Creek Landing Closed to Vehicle-Assisted Launches']
description: ['Due to recent flooding and heavy rain the Spring Creek Road is closed at the park boundary. The road system in the Erbie Historic District and surrounding area sustained significant damage too and is only passable with a 4x4, high clearance vehicle.', 'In the interest of safety, the South Woolum Road has been closed. The Woolum launch and campground remain open.', 'Parking will no longer be permitted on the road to allow space for emergency vehicles to safely enter the park. There will be ‘No Parking’ signs placed along the Kyles Landing Road, also known as County Road 56.', 'The Spring Creek Landing has been closed to vehicle-assisted launches. Watercraft may still be put in and take out at this point, but must be hand carried to and from the parking area. This is to ensure the safety of visitors and avoid continued erosion.']

title: ['River Ferry at Akers (on State Highway K) CLOSED until further notice']
description: ['The Akers Ferry on State Highway K will not be in service until further notice.']

title: ['ALL ROADS CLOSED Due to Snowstorm', 'North Entrance Road and Rim Drive are CLOSED for the season.']
description: ['Due to the latest winter storm and equipment challenges, ALL park roads are temporarily CLOSED to travel while the snowplow operators work to repair equipment and clear the roads.', 'Due to incoming snowstorms, the North Entrance Road and East & West Rim Drives are now closed for the season a few days ahead of the annual November 1st closure. The roads will not open again until mid to late June or July 2025. All other roads are open.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'All Park Roads CLOSED', 'id': 'F3C368C5-357C-4300-B7E4-84AEDD53FF0D', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/crla/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Seasonal Closure of North Entrance Road and Rim Drive', 'id': '60D26BCB-B47D-4B38-8562-EF54ACF41B59', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/crla/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['US 441/Newfound Gap Road is closed for high wind warning', 'Some park roads are closed for the season', 'Balsam Mountain, Cataloochee, and Big Creek areas closed', 'Several park trails are temporarily closed', 'US 441/Newfound Gap Road is open', 'Most visitors need a parking tag']
description: ["Due to forecasted high winds, US 441/Newfound Gap Road closed at 2 p.m. on Nov. 13. The website and the park's X account will be updated when it reopens.", 'Parson Branch and Rich Mountain roads are closed for the season.', 'While park staff address damage after Hurricane Helene, Balsam Mountain, Cataloochee, and Big Creek areas, campgrounds, and roads remain closed.', 'For closure information and details on other trail cautions, please check the "Trail and Backcountry Closures, Warnings & Cautions" section of the Current Road, Facility, Trail & Backcountry Updates page.', 'US 441/Newfound Gap Road is open to non-commercial vehicles. As always, commercial vehicles are prohibited on US 441/Newfound Gap Road.', 'All vehicles parking for longer than 15 minutes require a parking tag. Three tag durations are available for purchase for all vehicle sizes and types: Daily ($5), Weekly ($15), or Annual ($40).']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'US 441/Newfound Gap Road is closed for high wind warning', 'id': 'AF24BDC5-960C-42DB-A259-FA2245ABDF2A', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/grsm/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Some park roads are closed for the season', 'id': '59FE3FF5-72D8-4A65-81E6-E6F9D859A721', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/grsm/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Balsam Mountain, Cataloochee, and Big Creek areas closed', 'id': '6F2E112E-F026-4429-9548-1DA9B81CE784', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/grsm/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [], [], []]

title: ['Red Gate Fire Road', 'Tanners Ridge Fire Road']
description: ['Closed to vehicular traffic.', 'Closed to vehicular traffic.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Red Gate Fire Road', 'id': 'B7AF53DA-FA44-4743-B579-FF81CB68EE33', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/shen/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'Tanners Ridge Fire Road', 'id': 'C509E46A-FE91-4AE4-9D13-9ECFEFC2F89D', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/shen/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['Tioga Road (Hwy 120 through the park) and Glacier Point Road are temporarily closed']
description: ['Tioga Road (continuation of Highway 120 through the park) and Glacier Point Road are temporarily closed due to snow. Call 209/372-0200 (then 1, 1) for updates.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Tioga Road and Glacier Point Road Temporary Closure', 'id': 'FB64E2E0-9870-44DF-B6B4-6053CA46D17C', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/yose/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['Pierce Stocking Scenic Drive Winter & Spring Vehicle Road Closure', 'CR675 Culvert Replacement']
description: ['This road is closed to vehicles. It remains open to foot traffic. The seasonal reopening date is determined by the amount of sand, hazard trees, and debris that will need to be cleaned up or moved after winter storms. This is typically in mid-May.', 'Replacement of culvert on County Road 675 has started. Location of replacement is 0.25 miles West of S Westman Rd. S Dunns Farm Rd traffic will be rerouted. Kayakers, plan to paddle back upstream if launching at Fisher Road or put in North of CR 675.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Pierce Stocking Seasonal Road Closure', 'id': '3B1D9BF0-A6F5-49FA-82CD-9534FED70F90', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/slbe/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [{'title': 'County Road 675 Culvert Replacement', 'id': 'A90AAAF0-13D6-47FF-86A8-269EB4929DEA', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/slbe/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['Williams Ranch Road Closed', "Devil's Hall is a Strenuous Hike"]
description: ['The Williams Ranch Road is currently impassable and closed to public access due to unsafe conditions.', "The hike to Devil's Hall is rated as strenuous. The portion of the route in the wash requires rock scrambling and is dangerous when wet or if water is present. The wash surface is loose gravel and rocks and may be unstable."]

title: ['Village Connector Trails from Great Meadow Loop to Great Meadow Drive']
description: ['Village connector trails outside the park, along Cromwell Harbor Road from Great Meadow Loop to Great Meadow Drive, are closed to improve safety and accessibility. Hikers can walk along the roadway to access trails into the Sieur de Monts area.']

park: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park
title: ['North Rim Road', 'South Rim Drive and East Portal Road closed for winter', 'South Rim Road construction continuing in 2025']
description: ['The North Rim Road will close for the season on November 15.', 'South Rim Drive is closed past the visitor center. Until there is enough snow for grooming, it will remain open for pedestrians and bicycles. East Portal Road (managed by the BOR) is closed for winter. It will reopen in spring as conditions permit.', 'Major road improvement projects are complete for 2024. Construction will continue in 2025. Expect delays, alternating one-way traffic, and parking lot closures.']

title: ['Cima Road is now open!!!', 'Hart Mine Road Closed due to dangerous potential for collapse']
description: ['Cima Road is now open!!!', 'Hart Mine Road is missing several wooden culverts the burned in the 2023 York Fire. The road may appear intact but could cave in under the weight of a vehicle. Stay off of Hart Mine Road for your safety.']

park: Katahdin Woods and Waters National Monument
title: ['Loop Road and North Entrance Seasonal Closures']
description: ['The Loop Road and North Entrance are closed to motorized vehicles for the winter starting 11/4. These areas are accessible by foot, bike, ski, and snowshoe. Restrooms and campsites are accessible but not maintained in the off season. Learn more below.']

title: ['Mauna Loa Road past Kīpukapuaulu closed for survey work Mon.-Fri, 8:30 am to 4 p.m.']
description: ['Mauna Loa Road is closed past Kīpukapuaulu to all use for survey, drilling and soil sampling work, Monday thru Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. The road is open weekends and holidays.']

title: ['Construction Closures at LSR Preserve and Death Canyon']
description: ['Construction will close the Laurance S. Rockefeller Preserve entrance road and parking area on September 23 and Death Canyon Road and Trailhead on October 1. Access Phelps Lake and Death Canyon via the Valley Trail network. Planned to open for winter rec.']

title: ['November 13 2024 Volcano Road Closure', 'November 13 2024 Larger Vehicles Discouraged', 'Volcano Road Closed to RVs and Buses over 26 feet, and to all Trailers.']
description: ['November 13, 2024, Volcano Road will remain closed today due to over 7 feet of snow and park staff need more time to clear the road. Visitor Center, parkstore, museum, and park film are open.', 'November 13, 2024, Vehicles larger than 26 feet and trailers are strongly discouraged from visiting the park due to limited place to park or turn around because of snow and snow drifts impeding the parking lots. Please visit on a different day.', 'The Volcano top road is not accessible to RVs, buses, attached trailers, or any other vehicle over 26 feet in length, due to the narrowness and weight limits of Volcano Road. Trailer drop off and RV/bus parking is available at the Visitor Center.']

title: ['Most Park Roads Closed to All Vehicles', 'Vehicle entrance reservation not needed']
description: ['Most roads are closed to prepare for commercially-guided snowcoach and snowmobile travel during the winter season, which will begin December 15. The road between the North and Northeast entrances is the only road open year-round to regular vehicles.', 'Although an entrance pass is required to enter Yellowstone National Park, vehicle reservations are not needed. You are encouraged to purchase an entrance pass before arriving, but you may also purchase passes at any entrance station upon arrival.']

title: ['Portions of Braddock Road Trail Closed']
description: ['Portions of the Braddock Road Trail at the Indian Run bridge are closed until a new foot bridge is constructed.']

title: ['Bringing a Pet to Big Bend?']
description: ['Bringing your pet to Big Bend National Park will limit some of your park explorations and opportunities. Pets are not allowed on park trails, in the backcountry, or on the river. Pets are allowed only where vehicles can go. Pets may not be left unattended']

title: ['Mile Creek Road Realignment', 'Flooding on the Grand Portage Trail at Poplar Creek']
description: ['Construction to realign a portion of Mile Creek Road and construct a new bridge over Grand Portage Creek continues. Beginning Tuesday September 3, the public should expect traffic control flagging and temporary delays.', 'Increased rain and beaver dam activity this year flooded the Poplar Creek Crossing along the Grand Portage Trail. Please use caution as you pass through the water. Park staff is in the process of determining a drier route.']

title: ['Highway Construction Impacting Travel to the Memorial']
description: ['Numerous highway construction projects are occurring in the Black Hills and may impact trip planning to the Memorial. Please consult with South Dakota 511 to minimize delays or other inconveniences.']

park: Dayton Aviation Heritage National Historical Park
title: ['Temporary Road Closure on Hebble Creek near Huffman Prairie']
description: ['Huffman Prairie and the Flying Field will be inaccessible from 11/10/24 - 11/16/24. This road closure notice is for Hebble Creek Road. Beginning Sunday 11/10/24 Hebble Creek Road will have restricted traffic due to Natural Resources Management activities.']

title: ['Salmi Road Entrance to the Kab-Ash Trail out of the Kabetogama Community Remains Temporarily Closed.']
description: ["Salmi Road entrance to the Kab-Ash Trail remains temporarily closed at the trail's western most terminus. Access to the trail remains open at trailheads along Ash River Trail road, Meadwood Road, and the eastern terminus within the community of Ash River."]

title: ['Click on "caution" alerts below for important details on accessing the park', "Road construction on approach to park's Homestead entrance", 'Roadwork may cause delays on US 41/Tamiami Trail']
description: ['Tamiami Trail and State Road 9336 both have ongoing construction which may cause minor delays. If you have a scheduled tour, please plan accordingly.', 'Roadwork is underway along State Road 9336 leading to the Homestead entrance of the park, approaching the Ernest F. Coe Visitor Center. Drivers may experience short delays and should watch for personnel, construction equipment, and slowdowns.', "Current roadwork is ongoing along the park's northern boundary on US Highway 41/Tamiami Trail to raise the road for Everglades Restoration benefits. Drivers may experience up to 15-minute delays and should watch for personnel, equipment and slow downs."]

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can help prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots. Before leaving your car to catch the ferry: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['Partial Miles Creston Road Closure begins on July 10, 2024', 'Hawk Creek Lane Restriction at Lake Roosevelt National Recreation Area']
description: ['Lincoln County will be closing a portion of Miles Creston from Highway 2 to Copenhaver Road beginning July 10, 2024, through December 1, 2024. If you are accessing Lincoln Mill, Hawk Creek, or Seven Bays you may need to find an alternate route.', 'Due to undercutting action of Hawk Creek on the access road between the Hawk Creek campground and boat launch, the road will be reduced to one lane until further notice. Use caution while on this road.']

title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']
description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']

title: ['Vehicle Break-Ins: Take precautions to secure your vehicle and valuables.']
description: ["This is an urban park. Don't hide valuables inside your car. Carry items with you on hike. Lock your vehicle and set car alarm. Recent auto break-ins at Rinconada Canyon parking lot. Report suspicious persons loitering/peeking in cars. Call 928-638-7805"]

title: ['Dungeness Beach access closed to vehicular traffic until further notice']
description: ['Due to flooding conditions, concern for safety and to limit damage, Dungeness beach access is closed to all vehicular traffic until water recedes and it is deemed safe. Pedestrian traffic is open on hiking trail.']

title: ['Fort Donelson NB Road Access on Winter Schedule Beginning Sunday, November 3, 2024', 'County road through the Fort Heiman Unit is Closed to Vehicles Past the Pavilion']
description: ['From November 3, 2024, through March 9, 2025, vehicles may access park roads from 8:00 am to 4:30 pm for the winter season. Pedestrian Access remains from dawn to dusk.', 'Fort Heiman is located at 682 Fort Heiman Road, New Concord KY. Due to poor conditions of county roads, the County has posted the loop road closed to vehicles past the park pavilion. Pedestrian access is permitted.']

title: ['Vehicle Length Limits']
description: ["Vehicles longer than 24 feet are not permitted past the visitor center on Bonita Canyon Drive. Vehicles up to 29 feet are still allowed to stay in the campground, but can't go further. Parking for large vehicles and trailers is available at Faraway Ranch."]

title: ['New Mexico Road Advisories']
description: ['The New Mexico Department of Transportation updates its map of road advisories regularly. Visitors are encouraged to look for any possible road advisories along their route of travel beforehand.']

title: ['Park Operations Altered Due to Pretty Rocks Landslide', 'Road Open To: Mile 3 (Park Headquarters)']
description: ['Summer access to facilities and services in Denali remains altered due to the Pretty Rocks Landslide and the associated closure of the Park Road at Mile 43. Check here for more information on what to expect.', 'The Denali Park Road is currently open to Mile 3, Park Headquarters. Snowy conditions beyond that point prevent vehicle travel, though pedestrian travel is permitted.']

title: ['South Unit Road from the Old East Entrance station mile near marker 22 to mile marker 28']
description: ['Due to major road repair work, the former scenic loop between the Old East Entrance Station (near mile marker 22) and mile marker 28 is closed to all traffic, including pedestrian, and bicycle access.']

title: ['Portion of Kekaulike Avenue in Kula to close for approximately nine months']
description: ['A portion of Kekaulike Avenue (Route 377) between Waiakoa Road and ʻAlae Road will be closed for 24 hours, seven days a week, for approximately nine months.']

title: ['Government Wash closure to vehicle access and overnight camping']
description: ['Government Wash Road and 8.0 Mile Road will be blocked, and motor vehicle access and overnight camping in the area will be prohibited. Hiking, biking, and shoreline access by boat for recreation within 100 feet of the shoreline will remain available.']

park: Fort McHenry National Monument and Historic Shrine
title: ['Motorized Recreational Scooters Not Permitted in Park']
description: ['For the safety and protection of visitors and park resources, motorized scooters are not permitted within the park. Any vehicles (scooters, bicycles, etc.) that are part of a ride-share program may not be left behind for pick up inside the park']

title: ['Road to Exit Glacier Closed to Automobiles']
description: ['The Alaska Department of Transportation has closed Herman Leirer Road for winter. Therefore, the road to Exit Glacier under the National Park Service is closed as well. Reopening is typically in mid to late-May, with variation due snow and weather.']

title: ['Looking for a Grand Canyon view? A warning about mobile devices and map/navigation apps', 'Arizona Off-Highway Vehicle (OHV) Requirements for Residents and Non-residents.']
description: ['Map apps may direct you to Parashant if you search for directions to "Grand Canyon" due the canyon\'s name in both the national park and monument names. The national park has paved roads and services. Parashant has no services and rugged/remote conditions.', 'Off-highway vehicles (OHVs) are required by law to display a valid OHV decal to operate on public and state trust lands in Arizona. This includes “street legal” vehicles that meet these two requirements.']

title: ['Trail Ridge Road is Closed to Through Travel for the Season']
description: ['Trail Ridge Road (U.S. Hwy 34) is closed to vehicles to through travel for the season. Trail Ridge Road is closed on the east side of the park at Many Parks Curve and on the west side of the park at Colorado River Trailhead.']

title: ['AQUA Project to Install New Water Main Along Route 23', 'County Line Road Closed Monday To Friday']
description: ["Aqua project to install a new water main along route 23 will replace an outdated main. No impact to visitors at Washington's HQ or trail access - there will be some detours near the road, but the area will still be passable. Please stay out of worksite.", 'County Line Road is closed during the week, from Monday through Friday. The closure will apply to all vehicular, pedestrian, and bicycle traffic. Please find an alternate route.']

title: ['Roosevelt Campobello International Park is located in Welshpool.']
description: ['Campobello Island is located in the province of New Brunswick, Canada. The physical address for the Visitor Centre is: 459 Route 774 Welshpool, New Brunswick, Canada E5E 1A4']

title: ['Road work CA 190']
description: ['Expect delays up to 20 min along CA 190 between Towne Pass and Twenty Mule Team Canyon as Caltrans installs gabion structures to reduce the risk of road damage during flooding.']

title: ['Paces Mill Closed for Planned Rehabilitation Project']
description: ['Paces Mill will be closed until May 2025 with no access to parking, facilities, or the canoe launch. The last park boat ramp south of US-41 will soon re-open with very limited vehicle access for take-out. Plan to exit the river before Paces!']

title: ['Fire Restrictions in Place - NO Smoking']
description: ['Fire restrictions are in place at Tuzigoot National Monument. Smoking is prohibited, including Electronic Nicotine Delivery Systems (E.N.D.S.), except when inside a personal vehicle.']

title: ['Navigation']
description: ['Do not rely on GPS digital navigation systems to find your way to Badlands National Park. Please note that the Visitor Center at 25216 Ben Reifel Road, Interior SD 57750 is located just off I-90.']

title: ['Cascade River Road Seasonal Closure', 'Hozomeen Gate Remains Closed', 'Be Aware of Break-ins along State Route 20']
description: ['Cascade River Road is closed for the season at Eldorado (milepost 20). Check the road conditions page for more information.', 'The gate at Hozomeen remains closed to vehicle access from Canada. Winnebago Flats and the upper Hozomeen campgrounds will remain closed. For more information visit the news release on summer operations.', 'Prevent smashed windows and theft. Break-ins are not uncommon at trailheads along State Route 20. Remove your valuables and electronics and take associated electronic cords.']

title: ['Green River Ferry Status']
description: ['The Green River Ferry status can change without advanced warning. For the most up-to-date ferry status information please call the Green River Ferry Hotline at (270) 758-2166 or follow the Mammoth Cave Roads and Ferry Twitter feed.']

title: ['Road Damage']
description: ['Due to damage from heavy rains, some roads may require high clearance or 4x4 vehicles for passage. Please use caution when approaching and driving on roadways. Trailers over 30 ft not advised.']

title: ['Passaic River Trail Bridge washed out']
description: ["Tropical Storm Ida washed out the Passaic River bridge on the Patriot's Path Trail south of Tempe Wick Road. This area is a known habitat of the endangered wood turtle, so do not wade, walk, or let your dog run in the river at this location."]

title: ['The Use of GPS is NOT Recommended']
description: ['Numerous visitors have been routed to remote trailheads and out-of-the-way roads trying to use GPS to reach the main park area or shuttle stop.']

park: Sand Creek Massacre National Historic Site
title: ['8 Miles of Unpaved Road to Reach Park']
description: ['In order to reach the Sand Creek Massacre NHS, you must travel on at least 8 miles of unpaved roads. We are not able to guarantee road conditions of county roads 54 or W after spring storms.']

title: ['Road Conditions - 11/12/2024']
description: ['If entering into the park today, we recommend taking the north road (CR 7950). Having AWD or 4WD is advised, as there are still muddy sections along that road. We do not recommend taking the south road into the park (Hwy 57) for any reason.']

title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']
description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']

title: ['Brawner Restrooms Closed for the Season']
description: ['The Brawner Restrooms are now closed until Spring 2025. Restroom facilities are available across the way at Manassas NBP Headquarters located at 12521 Lee Highway.']

title: ['Backcountry vehicle route closed for the season', 'Trail closure for pipeline restoration project']
description: ['Due to this and upcoming winter storms, the backcountry vehicle route has closed for the season until May 15, 2025.', 'The VC09/South Valle Toledo/Posos Trail from the Valle Toledo parking area to the eastern park boundary is closed for restoration. The NPS is working on a trail reroute for the 2025 season and will provide details early next year.']

title: ['Visitor Center Parking Lot Construction', 'Scenic Drive Rehabilitation Project']
description: ['The visitor center parking lot is being expanded and reconfigured. It is partially closed to facilitate work. Expect flaggers. Look for signs to alternate parking for vehicles over 20 feet.', 'The Scenic Drive is closed from just south of the campground to Capitol Gorge for construction. Expect heavy truck traffic. Most of the park remains accessible. The road is currently expected to reopen in early December.']

title: ['Highway 180 Access To Cedar Grove Area of Kings Canyon National Park Closed For the Season', 'Tire Chains/Cables Required to Reach Sequoias', 'Mineral King Road Is Closed For the Season']
description: ['Highway 180 is closed east of Hume Lake Road for the winter season. Cedar Grove is not accessible. This section of road typically reopens in late April.', 'Chain restrictions are in effect to reach Grant Grove and Giant Forest, including the Sherman Tree. All vehicles including 4WD and AWD, must carry chains. Please call 559-565-3341, for current road conditions and chain control information', 'The portion of Mineral King Road inside Sequoia National Park is closed for the winter season to the general public. The road typically reopens in May on the Wednesday before Memorial Day, but could be later depending on conditions.']
relatedRoadEvents: [[{'title': 'Highway 180 Seasonal Closure', 'id': '02698AFD-CAAE-434F-8312-C023124680DA', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/seki/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}], [], [{'title': 'Mineral King Road Seasonal Closure', 'id': '5096154A-71A4-4F51-A7F8-98E102608092', 'type': 'roadevent', 'url': 'https://www.nps.gov/seki/planyourvisit/conditions.htm'}]]

title: ['Main Road Status']
description: ['All public roads are now open, to include Route 63 to Rainbow Point. Please do still use caution as temperatures remain near freezing.']

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['Miners River Bridge Closed']
description: ['The bridge connecting Miners Castle Road to Miners Beach is closed for a full bridge replacement. Closures will go through spring 2025.']

title: ['Trail Connection Between Ben Johnson Trail and Dipsea closed Monday-Thursday until January 2025', 'Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park', 'Parking & Shuttle Reservations Always Required - See "Know Before You Go" for Details']
description: ['Our trail crew will be working to rebuild switchbacks above the Stapelveldt junction. The trail is expected to be open most Fridays and weekends. Alternate routes are available on surrounding trails. Click more (link) for map.', 'You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.', 'Reservations are required for all personal vehicles and shuttle riders at Muir Woods. You can make your reservation by visiting www.gomuirwoods.com. Visit our "Know Before You Go" webpage to learn more important details before your visit.']

park: New River Gorge National Park and Preserve
title: ['Cunard Road closed from November 1 to about March 31, 2025']
description: ['Improvements to Cunard Road will begin on Monday November 4, 2024 extending through winter to about March 31, 2025. The road will be completely closed during this time.']

title: ['Riverview Road south of Boston Mill Visitor Center']
description: ["Starting Tuesday, October 22 Riverview Road will be closed just south of Boston for 60 days for bridge repairs. Visit the Summit County Engineer's website for a map of the detour route, which involves State Route 303, Black Road, and Boston Mills Road."]

title: ['Dunes Drive Safety Corridor', 'Park Closures', 'RV and Tractor Trailer Parking at the Visitor Center']
description: ['Dunes Drive is open. A safety corridor is in effect between mile marker 3 and 5.5 along Dunes Drive. Visitors may drive but not stop or exit their vehicle in this area.', 'From time to time the missile range that surrounds the park performs military testing that may require the closure of the park or Highway 70. Please plan your visit around upcoming military tests.', 'There is limited space for parking for recreational vehicles and trailers in the parking lot directly in front (south) of the visitor center. RVs are asked to not park in the lot behind the visitor center. There is no parking space for tractor trailers.']

park: Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park
title: ['Hiking in Gold Mine Tract']
description: ['Visitors are restricted to the designated trails within the Gold Mine Tract in the Great Falls area. This location is generally defined as that area bordered by MacArthur Boulevard and Berma Road and depicted on the Great Falls Maryland Hiking Map.']

title: ['Service Road Closure']
description: ['The walkway toward the lighthouse is closed to due construction of the roadway. Please do not enter the area.']

title: ['Road to East End']
description: ['Recent rains have caused an overgrowth of vegetation on the sides of the road heading to East End near Haulover. Please use extreme caution when driving. This park alert will be removed once the vegetations has been removed.']

title: ['Secure trash and food']
description: ['Pack it in, pack it out! There are no trash services in or around the monument. All food & trash must be secured inside a vehicle or hard sided containers. Ravens routinely open zipped bags & tear into trash bags left outside or in the bed of a truck.']

title: ['Auto-Theft Warning - Only Bring What You Need to the Park']
description: ['You can prevent vehicle break-ins in parking lots and scenic overlooks. Before leaving your car for even a short period of time: 1) Remove all valuables, 2) Lock your doors. 3) Take your cell phones and electronics with you. Read article for more details.']

title: ['Bottomland Nature Trail Will be Closed Starting September 3rd', 'Dangerous Highway Crossing']
description: ['The Bottomland Nature Trail will be closed beginning September 3rd for the trail resurfacing project. It will remain closed until work is complete. Fox Creek Trail remains open, but can only be accessed from the north through the under highway crossing.', 'Highway 177 is 60 mph with a blind spot directly across from the house. Safely use the highway underpass to the Fox Creek Trail just south of the visitor center parking lot. Be smart, stay alive.']

title: ['Box Canyon Day Use Area Closed']
description: ['Due to the recent illegal lighting of a fire in the trash bin, the theft of government signs, and the unauthorized movement of barricades to drive into an area closed to vehicle traffic, the metal gate at the upper end of Box Canyon has now been closed.']

title: ['Hurricane Ridge Road Status - Wednesday, Nov. 13th 8:05 am', 'Temporary bridge removal on North Shore Quinault Rd, closing Quinault Loop Drive', '"Sneaker Waves" and Other Risks from Atmospheric River this week']
description: ['Hurricane Ridge Road will be closed all day today due to snow. The road will reopen when conditions permit. Updates will be posted daily by 9:00 am.', 'The temporary bridge on the North Shore Quinault Road will be removed on Wednesday, October 23rd, and will remain removed through the winter. This will split the Quinault Loop Drive. To access the Graves Creek area, take South Shore Road.', 'Sneaker waves can catch beachgoers by surprise, sometimes with deadly results. Rain and winds throughout the Peninsula may also cause rising rivers, fallen trees, and unexpected road closures. Please visit with caution and carry emergency supplies.']

park: Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site
title: ['GPS Navigation Systems']
description: ["GPS navigation systems often misdirect visitors driving to Ulysses S. Grant National Historic Site. GPS systems often route visitors to our back gate, or to the entrance for Grant's Farm (not affiliated with the NPS). Please visit our directions page."]

title: ['Temporary Road and Parking Area Closures for Maintenance - Fall 2024', 'Adjustments to USS Cairo Museum and Visitor Center Days of Operation', 'National Cemetery Closed to Vehicles; Open to Pedestrians', 'Louisiana Circle Closed', "North Union Avenue and Grant's Circle Closed"]
description: ['The park will be conducting pavement maintenance for roads and parking areas. Work will include milling, paving, micro surfacing, and restriping. Follow the link below for a detailed list of temporary closures.', 'Starting October 2, 2024, the USS Cairo Museum will be open 7 days a week and the Visitor Center will be open Wednesday-Sunday. The park grounds, fee booth, Visitor Center restrooms, and tour road will remain open seven days a week.', 'Due to weather related incidents, Vicksburg National Cemetery is closed to vehicular traffic, however it is open to pedestrians. Visitor can park in the adjacent USS Cairo parking lot and walk into the cemetery.', 'Louisiana Circle is closed to vehicles and pedestrians due to slope instability. Navy Circle is open and also provides views of the Mississippi River.', "Due to weather related incidents, North Union Avenue and Grant's Circle are closed to vehicular and recreational traffic. Entering these areas is prohibited. A portion of Grant Avenue is open for touring."]

title: ['Reds Meadow Road and Devils Postpile National Monument are closed for the season']
description: ['Reds Meadow Road, which provides access to Devils Postpile National Monument, is closed for the season. It usually opens in June.']

title: ['Wilderness Road Trail closed between Gap Cave and Tennessee Road Trail', 'Storm Damage Hazards, Closures, and Updated Information']
description: ['Due to work on a bridge, the Wilderness Road trail is closed between Gap Cave and the Tennessee Road Trail', 'Damage from Hurricane Helene has created hazardous conditions and caused impacts to park roads, trails, and programs. Go to our Alerts & Conditions page for important safety and closure updates.']

title: ['Echo Park Road HC4WD and Yampa Bench Road may be Impassable']
description: ['Due to weather conditions, the Echo Park Road requires high-clearance 4-wheel drive. The Yampa Bench Road is not recommended and may be impassable.']

title: ['Trail at Meriams Corner Headed East is Closed for Trail Work']
description: ["Beginning Tuesday October 22, the Battle Road Trail from Meriam's Corner heading east will be closed for trail improvement work. Please do not enter the closure. The closure will last several weeks."]

title: ['11/12/2024 - Lassen National Park Highway Closed', 'Warner Valley Road Closed Beyond Trailhead Parking', 'Juniper Lake Road Closed']
description: ['The main park road (Hwy 89) is closed at Kohm Yah-mah-nee Visitor Center (southwest entrance) and Loomis Plaza/Manzanita Lake (northwest entrance) due to snow and ice. Please use caution if driving to the park and check weather forecasts:', 'Warner Valley Road remains closed at the trailhead parking area due to the 2021 Dixie Fire. The road will close at the park boundary once winter snow sets in. Follow the link to learn more about the Dixie Fire.', 'Juniper Lake Road remains closed to vehicle traffic after the 2021 Dixie Fire. There is no current re-opening date. The road is open to bicycle and pedestrian traffic. Learn more about the Dixie Fire:']

title: ['Please park legally and responsibly in Zion National Park and the Town of Springdale']
description: ['Zion has limited parking space. Park only in designated stalls. Vehicles parked outside of designated stalls are subject to citation and may be towed. Once all designated parking stalls in Zion are full, visitors should park in Springdale.']

title: ['Rehabilitation of Colonial Parkway continues with additional Parkway closures']
description: ['Beginning Tuesday, April 9, 2024, construction will close the Colonial Parkway to all travel in either direction between Yorktown and VA Route 199. Follow all detour signs. See additional closure information in the link below.']

title: ['Park Hours may Change due to Winter Storms', 'Cliff Palace Loop Road is Closed']
description: ['Winter storms and ice may cause opening delays or temporary closures allowing plows to safely clear the roads. Before visiting, check this page daily for up-to-date information. Colorado Traction Law may apply, see info below. Click link for weather', 'Due to construction, the Cliff Palace Loop Road (including access to Soda Canyon Overlook Trail) is closed. Great views of Cliff Palace are seen from Sun Temple on the Mesa Top Loop. Follow the link to the park map.']

park: Bent's Old Fort National Historic Site
title: ['A Short Walk is Required to Reach the Fort']
description: ["A 1/4 mile (1,275 feet) walk on a paved trail from the parking area is required to reach the gate of the fort. At the end of your visit, you'll return to your vehicle along the same path."]

park: Fredericksburg and Spotsylvania County Battlefields Memorial National Military Park
title: ['Park Road Work']
description: ['From 11/12/24 - approximately 12/6/24, contractors will repair and patch park roads and parking areas. There will be no full closures, but expect delays and partial closings. Follow signage and flaggers on site.']

title: ['Walnut Canyon Desert Drive Closed Due to Flood Damage']
description: ['Recent flooding has caused major damage to the road. It is unknown when repairs will begin or the length of time to complete. The main park road to the visitor center and cavern is open. For updates on the road and trails, click "More" below.']

title: ['Route 7 from Sawmill, AZ is NOT recommended']
description: ['Entering the park from the east at Sawmill, AZ on Route 7 is not recommended. Part of this route is UNPAVED and UNMAINTAINED. Please stay on paved roads, such as Indian Route 64 from Tsaile, AZ and Highway 191/Route 7 from Chinle, AZ.']

title: ['Newton B. Drury Scenic Parkway: Hike and Bike Day']
description: ['The Newton B. Drury Parkway is closed to vehicles on the first Saturday of each month from October to May for Hike and Bike Day. The parkway closes on the Friday night before the event and reopens Sunday afternoon.']

title: ['Trail Conditions']
description: ['Trail conditions can vary throughout the state. Before heading out, check the trail conditions, potential re-routes and closures on the Ice Age Trail Alliance website.']

title: ['Use Caution with GPS Navigation']
description: ['The new visitor center is located at 17970 US Hwy 30, about one mile north of downtown Hagerman and the old visitor center. Highway signs and GPS navigation may not yet be up-to-date.']

title: ['Notice to travelers to National Cemetery']
description: ['Due to the narrow roadway & tight turn, RVs, mobile homes, charter buses, delivery trucks, or vehicles with trailers are prohibited from the crest of Monument Hill. Check for information about parking at the Visitor Center upon your arrival.']

title: ['Going-to-the-Sun Road Seasonal Closure']
description: ['The Going-to-the-Sun Road is closed for the season from Avalanche Creek to Jackson Glacier Overlook. Hiker-biker access beyond these points is permitted. Winter weather conditions may change the location of these closures at any time.']

park: Carl Sandburg Home National Historic Site
title: ['Pedestrian Bridge at Front Lake is Closed']
description: ['The pedestrian bridge at the main entrance to the park is closed. A 6-passenger accessible shuttle runs daily every 20 minutes from 9:40 am to 4:20 pm, from the main parking lot, on Little River Road, to the Sandburg Home and farm area.']

title: ['Vehicle Break-Ins']
description: ["Saguaro National Park is an urban park. Vehicle break-ins have occurred at trailheads around the park. Don't make yourself a target. Leave valuables at home, secure your vehicle, and report any suspicious activity."]

title: ['Due to flooding access points to Bluestone National Scenic River are closed']
description: ['All access points to the park are currently closed. The road through Bluestone State Park and the Lilly access are currently closed due to flooding. Parts of the Bluestone Turnpike Trail may be flooded.']

title: ['Paradise Road Status: Closed Tuesdays through Thursday', 'Many park roads are closed for the winter season.', 'Always check signs on closed road gates before recreating; roads closed to all use if work underway.', 'All vehicles are required to carry tire chains Nov 1 - May 1 when traveling in the park.']
description: ['11/13/2024: The gate to Paradise at Longmire will be closed Tuesday through Thursday due to staffing. The road to Longmire is open. All vehicles, including 4WD and AWD vehicles, are required to carry tire chains Nov 1 - May 1.', 'Many park roads are closed for the winter season, including White River, Sunrise, Mowich Lake, Stevens Canyon, Westside Road, and SR410/123.', 'Closed roads may be open to non-motorized vehicles like bicycles. CHECK SIGNS on closed road gates before proceeding. During snow plowing operations or when otherwise posted, park roads are closed to all use, including hiking, bicycling, skiing, etc.', 'All vehicles, including 4WD and AWD vehicles, must carry tire chains in the park during the winter season (November 1 - May 1) and be prepared to use them when tire chain requirements are posted.']

title: ['Fire Ban in Effect']
description: ['Fire Ban in Effect as of July 24th, 2024, at 2 PM. No open fires with wood/charcoal are permitted in the park. Gas/Propane stoves are permitted. Smoking allowed only in Vehicles or Paved Parking Lots. No Fireworks Allowed at all times. 36 CFR 1.5(a)(1).']

title: ['Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail Closure along George Washington Memorial Parkway', 'Some facilities closed along the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail']
description: ['There is a temporary closure of the Potomac Heritage National Scenic Trail crossing underneath Glebe Road Bridge due to construction along the George Washington Memorial Parkway. This work is a subsect of the North Parkway rehabilitation.', 'Please see our partner sites to find the most up-to-date information on closures, re-routes, or conditions along the Trail.']

title: ['Temporary Nighttime Road Closures for Deer Management']
description: ['From November 1, 2024 to March 31, 2025, the NPS may temporarily close select park roads between 5 p.m. to 4 a.m. to conduct deer management operations. Per the Rock Creek Park Superintendent’s Compendium, trails and other park areas close at sunset.']

title: ['The Park Will Remain Closed Friday, November 8 Due to a Winter Storm - Reopen Sat. 11/9 at 11am']
description: ['The park is anticipated to reopen after a 2-hour delay on Saturday morning, 11/9 at 11:00am. A Hazardous Weather Outlook and Winter Storm Warning are in place. Check the forecast at weather.gov and road conditions at cotrip.org.']

title: ['Temporary Blackland Prairie Trail Closure to Equestrians']
description: ['Heavy rain has undermined a culvert making it unsafe for passage. Due to horse trailer parking availability, the entire section is closed to equestrians. Hikers are still able to travel from the railroad tracks to the Parkway Visitor Center.']

park: Craters of the Moon National Monument and Preserve
title: ['Caves Area and Tree Molds Trail Closed', 'Navigation']
description: ['As of Nov 11, due to snow, the Caves area and Tree Molds Trail access are closed. The Loop Road is open. Campground remains open for winter camping, $8 night or $4 with an Access or Senior National Park Pass. Message will be updated as conditions change.', 'Please do not rely upon GPS digital navigation systems to find your way to Craters of the Moon. Please note that the Visitor Center at 1266 Craters Loop Road is located just off U.S. Highway 20/26/93 and is not accessed via any unpaved roads.']

title: ['If you have been redirected from the New Jersey Coastal Heritage Trail Route']
description: ["You were redirected to this site from the New Jersey Coastal Heritage Trail Route because of a sunset clause in the Trail's federal legislation, the NPS lost its legislative authority to manage the trail after 9-30-2011."]

title: ['NPS 300 Road Conditions']
description: ['NPS 300 to Big Tubes is covered with a minimum 6 inches of snow. A four-wheel drive, high clearance vehicle is required.']

title: ['Warning about GPS Systems!']
description: ['Vehicle Navigation Systems and GPS units may provide inaccurate information—sending drivers the wrong way on one-way roads, leading them to dead ends in remote areas, or sending them on roads which are impassable. Use the Interstate exits for wayfinding.']

title: ['Hart Mine Road CLOSED due to collapsed culverts', 'Most Monument Roads Require Heavy Duty 4WD Vehicle to Travel Safely', 'Use Caution on Roads with Debris']
description: ['Do not drive on Hart Mine Road. Missing culverts are hazardous for all vehicles and road is subject to sudden collapse. Please do not drive around signed barricades.', 'Breaking down in the remote monument can be a life-threatening emergency. Most roads require a well-equipped, heavy-duty 4WD vehicle to travel. 2WD high clearance vehicles must use Walking Box Ranch Rd for entry and exit. No Visitor Facilities Available.', 'Flooding has resulted in debris along many roads within the park boundaries. Please use caution when driving on paved roads and watch for road crews at work. Be aware that unimproved and dirt roads may be impassible due to washouts, so plan accordingly.']

title: ['Slant Rock Road Closed to Vehicular Traffic']
description: ['Due to washout and bad road conditions Slant Rock Road has been closed to all traffic aside from hikers and bikers. To access Slant Rock, park your vehicle at the hunting inspection station off of Road 103.']

park: Paterson Great Falls National Historical Park
title: ['Overlook Parking Lot Unavailable After Dark', 'Heavy Construction Vehicle Operations & Limited Amphitheater Accessibility']
description: ["The park parking lot at 72 McBride Extension is open from dawn to dusk every day. Any vehicles left in the parking lot after dusk (i.e. sunset) are subject to towing at owner's expense.", 'Heavy construction vehicles are operating through the parking lot & Lower Overlook Park - use caution & be vigilant for hazards. Lower Overlook & Amphitheater access is via stairs only for construction duration.']
